text: it has been considered the most
important vote in Colombia for decades
but less than 40 percent of those
registered to take part actually went to
the polling stations of those who did
the majority decided to say no no to the
peace deal that less than a week ago was
signed by President Juan Manuel Santos
and the leader of the FARC Rodrigo Londo
knew to put an end to 52 years of a
bloody war that has left more than
220,000 people dead and millions
displaced it was a brexit moment for
many in Colombia the yes vote was beaten
by a small margin but now in Colombia
many are saying and thinking how they
can carry the agreement forward
regardless of the blurry sight quotient
actors as president I am old entirely my
ability and my responsibility to
maintain public order and to continue to
seek and to negotiate for peace the
existing bilateral ceasefire and end of
hostilities is in effect and will
continue to be in effect he wants to
meet with those who supported the No to
find a way forward what that way will be
is not yet clear
Natalia kozo BBC news in Bogota Colombia
